intro: Tragiopsis didyma, commonly known as the narrowleaf burrweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces tiny, spiky fruits that are adapted for dispersal by animals. Tragiopsis didyma is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it a resilient species in its native habitat.
